articles.title: Saudi Arabia coach denies team given Rolls Royces after Argentina stunner
articles.description: There won't be 26 new Rolls-Royces hitting the streets of Riyadh after all.
articles.content:
There won’t be 26 new Rolls-Royces hitting the streets of Riyadh after all.

articles.title: In the first World Cup after Maradona’s death, his teammates and fans feel the void while celebrating his legacy in Doha
articles.description: Former Argentina greats Burruchaga, Giusti, Batista among others were at the fan zone; there was a spontaneous outpouring of emotion among Argentine fans in Doha.
articles.content: Under the inky sky on Friday night, a wave of white and blue spilled onto the CONMEBOL fan zone in Central Doha’s Msheireb, wearing and waving Argentina’s most famous No.10 jersey. The name printed above the No.10 did not belong to its incumbent Lion... [5539 chars]

articles.title: Soccer-Milik backs up Lewandowski for Poles, injury-forced changes for Saudi Arabia
articles.description: The switch will be welcomed by Lewandowski, who has openly requested support in attacking duties in the recent months. articles.content:
